39447493.review: Great game/app, well polished, easy to use & you can include your own music to the actual training - it calculates the beat and you train to it. If you want to get moving or if you just want to have fun then don't hesitate to buy this.

39435106.review:
BOXVR:
~~~~~~  

Fitness has been a hot topic for as long as I can remember, either keeping bodies in shape or getting them into shape. Let me throw my hat in the ring . . . as a young frog, I used to be super fit, playing soccer at least four times a week (training), plus a full game on the weekend. Then I discovered cooking and fine wines in my mid-twenties, and since then I have accumulated a little bit of fat on my belly. Yeah, I am overweight! This year (2018), I am bringing back my fitness with a daily trip to the gym. Can I fit in some BOXVR as part of my daily routine?

BOXVR is a VR Boxing game where you can take several workout sessions to eliminate as many calories as possible in the comfort of your own home.

First, you’ll need to put your height and weight into the system. Then, you’ll be prompted to go to the main menu where you’ll see a board with your statistics on the left, telling you how many workouts you’ve done, how many calories you’ve burnt, and your percentage of hits.  The rest of the board will give you several other workout options and a tutorial. You can select workouts designed by the developers, try to exercise as long as you can with the survive mode, or train with your own favourite soundtracks. 

I was really excited the designed workouts. There are 17 available to you, choosing between beginner, power, speed, endurance or super endurance. The workout times vary from 5 to 37 minutes. You also have four locations in which to pursue your training: The New York gym, a graveyard, a dark tunnel and a festive winter holiday place. 

The gameplay is absolutely sublime; balls of different colours will come at you at varying speeds, coordinated with music. Some balls will have an arrow, either on a side or underneath, which indicate from which direction you need to hit them, and with which hand.  So get ready to punch, jab and give your best uppercuts! You will have to block incoming objects, as well as squatting and ducking overhead bars.  The other aspect I like about BOXVR is the leader board, which will definitely push you do a good workout in order to grab the top spot, if that’s your motivation. Plus, hitting a ball with more intensity will get you more points.  Keep up your hitting streak and you’ll earn extra multiplier points.  There’s plenty to challenge you and have a great workout!

Personally, I find this game very fluid; I tried several workouts, including the endurance, and I was buggered and dripping with sweat by the end of it! The funny part is that my 65 year-old mother gave it a go and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Then my wife hijacked my computer for a little try.  Fifty minutes later, her checks were bright red - we decided to have a session once a day as part of our daily routine. Yes, BOXVR will give you a seriously good workout! You can even set a daily goal of how many calories you wish to burn.

Graphically, the game is fabulous and the soundtrack is really cool and upbeat; you can train with your own music too.  The developers are going to release more workouts, which will be fab!  One thing I would like to see is more locations; maybe in China, for example, hitting dragon heads.

Positives:
~~~~~~~ 

-	Great graphics
-	Great soundtrack
-	Several workout modes (beginner, speed, power, endurance)
-	Train with your own music
-	You’ll burn plenty of calories

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	No achievements or trading cards as yet
-	I’ll love to see more locations with new themes

Want a good workout to burn serious calories? Become a student of Sam and Jonno. I’ll be seeing them daily from now on!

8/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

39430901.review:
[h1]Let us get fit[/h1]

[b]Disclaimer[/b] 
First of all I got this product for free from the developer(s), nevertheless I will review it honestly.

My current room-scale set-up is 1.5x2.5m, and I am not as much affected by motion sickness (anymore).

Furthermore I am no Fitness-Instructor, therefore I cannot professionally judge how effective this method is to get fit.

[b]Overview[/b]
You have several modes you can choose from like Survival (you have a number of life's and try to get a high-score), Fitness-program (as told by the Dev's actually created by real Fitness-Instructors) and your own workout (with your own music).

It is really addictive to play this game but please take the first info-screen you get presented with on start-up seriously and mind your body and not overdo it.

Personally I love the Workout with my own music on which it creates a challenge automatically.

You will not only perform different hits on the target (front, side, upper-cut, block) but you also need to evade obstacles coming up by crouching or tilting your body to the side.

[b]Rating[/b]
9/10 for regular Gamers
10/10 for those who want to prepare for a 220M$ fight :)

[b]The highlights[/b]
[list]
[*] Addictive gameplay
[*] Many modes to choose from
[*] Different Sceneries
[*] Good graphics
[*] Ability to create workout with your playlist
[/list]

[b]The lowlights[/b]
[list]
[*] Not all features implemented yet (Early Access title)
[/list]

[b]Multiplayer[/b]
No! (EarlyAccess)
But you have online Leader-boards

[b]Mods[/b]
No! (EarlyAccess)

[b]Motion Sickness[/b]
Since you are standing in one spot it will not cause any nausea

[b]Microtransactions/DLC[/b]
No! (EarlyAccess)

[b]Summary[/b]
As I tested this one the first time I could barely stop.
!!Please do yourself the favour and stop once you feel exhausted, as advised.!!

It is fun to do this kind of workout for short sessions a day, listening to your favourite music while moving your body is addictive. I am looking forward to how this game develops during the course of the Early Access but it feels like a complete experience already.

So if you would like to do something similar to a real-workout this might be the game for you and absolutely worth the price.

I might update this review after I got more experience playing it, so stay tuned.


[b]Xium as curator[/b]
Please check my curator profile to find other reviews and follow if you like:
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31700185-Swiss-Gaming-Collective-%28VR-Fl/

39406583.review: This game makes working out fun. Hate squats? You will naturally do them without thinking twice when a giant log is flying at your head.

39404920.review: This game is brilliant!  Honestly.  Just did one of the Power workouts, scored in the top 100 :)  Kept playing after for like 15 minutes and was having sooo much fun!  Sweat a bucket load, but this one game I will play constantly.  And I highly recommend if you need cardio in your life!  If in the future they connect with Spotify or something and you can connect the bpm's.... would be awesome

39355557.review:
이 게임의 장점은 너무 많으니 단점을 좀 적겠습니다.
1. 최적화 문제 - 다른 더 복잡한 게임도 버벅임이 별로 없는데 비해서 고정된 장소에서 풍선만 날아오는 데도 버벅임이 있네요.
2. 판정문제 -실제 복싱하듯이 주먹을 지르면 판정이 박한데 반해 주먹을 세로로 세우고 찍듯이 치면깔짝깔짝해도 판정이 들어갑니다. 훅도 마찬가지로 실제 훅을 치듯이 하기보다는 고양이 앞발 날리듯 깔짝깔짝해야 판정이 들어갑니다. 실제대로 하면 펀치가 풍선을 뚫고 지나가는 경우가 너무 많아요서바이벌의 경우 실제 복싱처럼하면 2레벨이 최고나 손을 가슴에 모으고 앞에 말한 것처럼 주먹을 세우고 크게 움직이지 않으면 20레벨도 문제 없습니다.
3. 기록문제 - mp3를 가지고 하는 트레이닝이나 서바이벌 게임을 한시간을 했는데도 실제 운동시간은 0분이네요

39338977.review: Great game. For some reason I can't select the tutorial. It needs some stability and controllers improvement. Sometimes the game freeze for 1 or 2 seconds. Also, sometimes I hit the targets but it doesn't count them.

39317832.review: Very cool! I was hoping to do the tutorial but it didn't work when I clicked on it from the menu. Did one of the beginner workouts instead. Then I realized that some of the things I was supposed to hit were supposed to be crosses... I'm hoping that once the bug for the tutorial is fixed, it'll clarify my confusion. :)

39309053.review:
I was expecting to be underwhelmed by this title... and instead, it has now replaced all my other music/exercise apps as my go-to.

The incluson of uppercut / jump / etc. really sold me on it, and the "feel" of the accuracy you need as well as the game's wonderful ability to amp up and down the music (being fair to recovery times)... makes this a real results driver.

Are you totally unfit?  Get this.  In a few weeks, I imagine you'll see results.  I got to meet the London devs in the high-rise on South Bank and those guys were equally as cool.

My one bugbear was the lack of a friends comparison page (partity with simillar games) and the tactile feedback through my transducer seems to needs  bit of tweaking from their side.  Otherwise, I'm very positive about the whole thing.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wd6LT3gqjgQ

Definitely deserves a go and I think it will become a staple for you on VR exercise night.  Cheers!

39267491.review:
I'm into rhythm games (already own Audioshield and Holodance, and used to play DDR at the arcades), but I specifically bought BoxVR for the workout aspect, which it delivers on.

Holodance is my go-to rhythm game, but the difference is that in Holodance (and Audioshield) you "catch" notes, whereas in BoxVR, you need to actively "hit" them.

Overall very polished, and even though it still needs some improvement, like not just having circles come at you for different types of hits (left hooks and right hooks are almost identical, for example; blocks aren't differentiated well enough from regular hits) but I didn't have any problem with unregistered hits, which I think has since been fixed from just before (or maybe just after) I bought it.

39196386.review:
Given that this product is still early access, BoxVR makes it VERY obvious that the game is incompleted at this time. Although it's a great work out when you're in the rhythm,however the faulty hit registration, awkward screen centering, off-beat music and the lack of variety in music really makes it frustrating to want to come back..

The hit registration is especially bad, as there are no indicators as to where the punch can be drawn to. 

The forced left/right stance change is annoying as well and can really mess up your rhythm and even hurt yourself if you're not used to moving/dodging on your opposite stance.

Overall, I don't think this product is worth the price tag yet. Once they figure out how to synchronise the music properly and fix their hit registration, along with a greater variety of music, I think I might give this a 5/5.. for now, 2/5

39177086.review:
很棒的音樂節奏運動遊戲，可以達到很好的健身效果，不過仍有幾點想建議

1. 自選歌曲選單再每次遊玩結束都會跳到目錄最上層，一直重選目錄有點煩。
2. 自選歌曲沒有卡路里累加計算，無法直接知道總共消耗了多少熱量。
3. 歌曲到達尾聲的時候，拳套仍然持續出現。

39167243.review: This is a superb idea and works really well. It has become part of my main daily exercise routine. The devs are very active and continuously monitor and respond to feedback and ideas, incorporating the better ones on a regular basis. A big thumbs up from me.

39120676.review:
Genuinely gets you sweaty and your heart rate up (23 minute session, avg 158 HR, 175 peak).  Calorie tracking is roughly on par with what an APP with HR says (give or take 20%). Your headset linear will get sweaty (consider extra liners)

Good fun in its own right and decidely more appealing than going to the gym (been there, done that, never again).  Remains to be seen (new owner) if this manages to keep me coming back.    

The punch tracking precision (on an oculus w touch) is good but not perfect - sometimes it feels like I got the punch right, but missed anyway, so here's to hoping it's just an early access defect.

Basic stats tracking - could benefit from a session log (so you can compare performance between sessions)

39092487.review: This is becoming one of my favorite games of the year VR or non. Really good workout and fun. One of the few forms of exercise I actually find enjoyable. This and The Thrill of the Fight are pretty much must buys for anyone looking to get a VR workout. No cons, worth the full price.

39090626.review: This is THE BEST workout game I've ever played.  My wife, who never wants to exercise or play any game, gets addicted to this game as well.  I think adding a function to allow us create more than one profile in the game would help if there are more than one person in the family trying to play.

39090101.review:
Fantastic!!

I wont go into details because tere are many reviews already but suffice to say it's one of the best 'Rythm' games in VR you could play. (IMO)

I tried the BETA branch (5 Jan) and it ruined it for me, made it way to easy so reverted back to the normal vers. I know folks were complaning about the uppercuts being too hard, they just require more practice and better timing. 

I'm new to the game and I can hit 95% of them on hard lvl.


Beta branch made it possible to hit the Uppercuts with jabs FFS!!

Anyway.

10/10

39073685.review: In the 1.7 hours that I've played this game, I've been more frustrated than anything else. The hit detection in this game is way, way off. If I use the beta patch as others have described in the forums, hitting hooks and uppercuts are incredibly difficult to hit consistently, while normal punches are a breeze. On the normal patch, normal punches are impossible to hit and hooks and uppercuts are easier. Either way the game is unplayable for me at the moment. If they can fix their hit detection, this will be a great game. Until you've heard otherwise though, stay away.
39073685.developer_response:
Hi Devyn,

We released an updated hit detection mechanism last Friday. The feedback  from several users has been that it has fixed the experience for them. Please let us know if you see an improvement. 

Thanks

39069964.review: The game was great, but the calorie counter is inaccurate and it takes long to load your own songs, though this could be because I downloaded this game to my hard drive and not the ssd.

39065075.review:
I got a little bit worried from reading some of the reviews. I thought the tracking would be annoying but I can honestly say that's not the case. I'm not sure what the person was doing who felt they had issues with the tracking, because it's pretty simple: you input your height, weight and then you keep your fists close to body. I also thought it would be kinda easy to just get away with my movement in the sense that it won't register upper cuts etc, but that's not the case either. I suppose the only downside is that you need music on your computer, which is something I haven't had in years. Some integration with either YouTube or Spotify would be cool. I hope that the developers keep this game updated and fresh!

I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to try and get into shape while having some fun in VR. It really makes you sweat and man does my badonkadonk hurt from all the dodging!

39058702.review: Best VR workout to date, lots of fun and an active developer!

39054871.review: great for training to kill your enemies

39031358.review:
This game is amazing. I was having such a good time halfway through the first round I started laughing- it actually feels like dancing. I played until my legs got wobbly. I am glad I found a form of cardio I really enjoy other than cycling- I absolutely hate treadmills and elipticals. Plus you can add your own songs, so I added a whole bunch of rythmic trance music and it never gets old.

This reminds me of tricking a baby into eating babyfood by pretending it's an airplane. You don't even realize you're working out.

38846317.review:
펀치 뿐 아니라 스쿼트, 닷지 등을 통해 하체도 함께 운동시켜주는 게임.

전반적으로 추천하는 제품이다.

38833122.review: Played for like 15 minutes and its instantly amazing!  This is a must-have for anyone who has VR and wants exercise, or enjoys music games, period.

38805685.review:
Wow, A lot of fun and such a workout.  Great Cardio.

I wish that we could save profiles.   My wife and I need to change settings for height and weight all the time.   Plus I would like to save Play lists rather than have to pick them each time after my wife has been on there.

Looking forward to more, and hope that hand and feet sensors are on the roadmap for more added goodness.

38796823.review: I have a lot of games on Steam.  I’ve never felt a need to write a review for any of them but I absolutely had to write one for this game.  I think this is the first time I’ve had this much fun exercising!  I have a wii and PlayStation Move which were fun but adding VR takes it to a whole new level!  I would like to see more environments.  I think the spooky environment is my favorite so far.  Maybe I’m missing it but I would like to be able to add other family members instead of them using my profile.  I can definitely see myself using this regularly and for that I thank the developers for making a game that an out of shape mother of 2 can really enjoy!

38787520.review:
The devs were kind enough to gift me a copy of this game for free and I am really thankful for it. 

Now for the review, this game really works at getting your heart pumping. In fact so well that I started to wear a sweatband on my head when playing so that I dont get the vr headset foam all sweaty after a session.

The game has a few premade workouts in various categories all ranging in length and intensity, but for me the real star of the game is the endless mode where you try to survive as long as possible and playing to your own music in the game. Just dont make a mistake like me and put too many songs on the playlist because if you dont finish it wont save your score and stats.

The best part of the game is how fast it seems to make the time go by while playing; before you know it 30 mins have gone by but it only seems like 5 or 10. Its also incredibly rewarding when playing on harder difficulties and big strings of all the types of punches get mixed together with blocking and you just get totally overwhelmed, but after a little time playing you just "get into the zone" and are able to hit the patterns without even thinking about it.

38742090.review:
Ein wirklich gutes Spiel!
Erst dankt man, das kann nicht anstrengend sein, nach 3 min wird einem dann aber doch ganz schön warm!
Für dieses Spiel macht das 2. Ersatzpolster der Vive Sinn :)!

38732491.review:
Its a great game that really challenge you body. Easy to learn and extremely fun. Now if all fat kids in school had access to this i think we would see some serious drop i kgs. 

The only thing I miss is to have a setting where you can see all arrows. Sometimes you dont want to think, just hit, and then I find myself missing balls because i hit with the wrong hand. Was it green right, was it gren left? Yeah, id like to have the option or mode that removes that.

38718655.review: If you are looking for a good vr excercise experience, BOXVR is one of the best on the market. BOXVR has completly changed my entire perspective on vr and now I am primarily using it to get a good workout in since I am so busy with school. I really look forward to what they add over the early access experience, but what is there now is completely worth the price.

38716501.review:
This game is great !! Plays awesome on Oculus RIFT !!!
I wanted to purchase a fitness game to go along with my new Fitbit; this is the game right here.  It's quick, intense, good music and most importantly FUN !!  I've tried other "fitness" games, but none are as fun as BOXVR

I plan on playing this 15 or so minutes a day for my quick workouts.  Highly recommended !!

38711207.review:
I know my playtime is low but thats only because I pulled a leg muscle trying to squat in endurance mode and now it hurts to walk. 


10/10 would pull my leg muscle again

38676527.review:
I wish there was a "lukewarm" option because I don't strongly dislike this game, but in the current state I certainly can't say I like it. I want to say first up that spent some time on the forums and I think the devs are top notch. I have little doubt that this game will be worth purchasing down the road because the devs seem to be very active in the community and I think they're really working hard to make the game better. 

That said, in the current form I find this game a lot more frustrating than fun. The biggest reason is that the hit detection is extremely poor in my experience. While it's possible that there's some issue with my setup (3 sensor Rift), I've had no issues with any other games. Maybe I just suck, but it's very difficult to tell what the source of the issue is because there is no feedback to allow you to improve. I see that this is listed as one of the dev goals; if properly implemented that could go a long way in improving the game. 

It still stands that right now, a frustrating number of jab and cross orbs simply go right through your boxing glove. After a bunch of experimentation I found that using slow, swiping gestures resulted in the best game performance, but it doesn't result in much of a workout and it also doesn't feel very satisfying. Oddly I had no problems with the uppercuts or hooks -when I missed I felt like it was my own fault. The dodge and duck mechanics go totally the other way, being so absurdly forgiving that a slight dip of a few inches is enough to clear the obstacle. 

So basically I can either try to punch hard and fast and have 80% of the orbs go right through my gloves, or do easy swipes and lazy dodges and get a pretty good score. 

The other problem I have with the game isn't really early access related, and may be more of a long term problem. Compared to other workout games I've played (thinking mainly of Soundboxing and Holopoint here), BoxVR is just kind of boring. While the variety of punch types is awesome and the uppercuts and hooks feel great, still the punches all land at the same place and other than changing your stance a few times during a song and doing a few very forgiving squats you're not really moving around much. Also, compared to other rhythm VR games, even the fastest workout speeds are pretty slow.  

The end result to me is that it feels like you're doing a somewhat enjoyable but bland workout while wearing a headset. Soundboxing (with a decent beatmap) is a total blast of a game which just incidentally results in an amazing workout – you're using the whole width and height of your room and punching at a frantic rate. Holopoint as well feels so much more dynamic than just standing in the center of your room looking forward, punching at the same height and doing the odd half-assed squat. 

Pros: Great devs - Punch types and inclusion of dodges add variety 

Cons: Poor hit detection – Little spatial movement – Bland workouts – Little musical variety – Comparatively ineffective workout – Inaccurate calorie counter

Summary – If this was the only VR workout game in existence, I would recommend it. As it is, there are multiple options that are better workouts, more fun and cheaper.

38655494.review:
シンプルに表現するならば、良く出来たボクシングタイプのVRエクササイズタイトルである。
　ボクシングは詳しくないので、表現が間違っていたら申し訳ないが、飛んでくるオーブとバーに対して、左右のストレート、フック、アッパーと、ウェービング、ダッキングを行ってプレイする。
　何種類か用意されているコースを選択してプレイでき、譜面にもよるだろうがかなりの汗をかける。
　そして、何と言っても自分で用意したサウンドファイルにも対応できる上に、曲を分析してある程度リズムに合った譜面を生み出してくれるので、自分で用意した曲でもリズムに乗せてくれる点が特に素晴らしい(その代償として自分で用意した曲の場合、一曲登録毎にある程度の分析待機時間が必要となる)。
　VRエクササイズタイトルとして、個人的にオススメできる作品である。

38644590.review:
You must buy this. An amazing workout game. I played for an hour straight, the moment I started playing I was hooked.
The work outs they have set up are well spaced out between short warm ups to long hard work outs. Work at your own pace with different difficulties. They added the ability to play to your own music. I can not wait to see where this games goes. This game may not have the best graphics and some songs I uploaded didnt match the tempo that I was punching but set those small things aside and its worth the purchase. There is a learning curve, you have to be ontop of those balls as they fly to you or else youll swing too early or too late. Keep hitting strong and youll burn fat in no time.

38640575.review:
A true early access game. Pretty barebones and weak on the graphics, BUT I will still recommend it. As someone who hates cardio, and at the same time does moderate weight lifting daily, the game has me sweating like a pig whenever I play it. It also gives a shoulder workout.

What I would love to see in the game:
1) More tracks
2) Better environments
3) Better way to select your own music. My library is currently on a different drive, and I couldn't figure out how to navigate to it.
4) I use Rift, and when I make a fist, the gloves don't really show any visual feedback. Would be nice to have it.
5) Improved visuals

The game also always tries to start with some parameters and steam keep prompting me if I want to allow it. 38516618.review:
I really enjoy this game.

The beat mapping works pretty well in terms of tempo of your songs and on some of them it really is in tune with the rhythm. It's impressive since I really love hip hop and I wouldn't consider Migos, Kanye West, Gucci Mane, and other rappers like that to be the main music that Vive/Rift owners listen to. So the other alternative Soundboxing may not have the songs I like mapped out to box to (I haven't tried it because I typically see pop music or EDM in the gameplay and I don't like that type of music at all). Well in BoxVR I don't need to worry about it.

BoxVR has it's own algorithm that maps out your beats like Audioshield. Audioshield is enjoyable, but doesn't quite have the same effect as BoxVR since I really enjoying punching more than moving my hands around with the shields. Not to diss either game since I think they are both great, and I own both of them.

Anyways, this is a good game for a quick work out or to just punch dance your rage out to your favorite songs! I really am glad I purchased this. From a 25 minute session I already am sore the next day in my shoulders and from the squats, not a ton, but I work in a cubicle and am not too active so it's actually a fun way for me to get some light cardio workout while listening to songs I enjoy!

Great work devs! Can't wait for more content and updates!

38495259.review:
BoxVR has quickly become my favorite VR "game". 

I've put "game" in quotes, because BoxVR is really a VR workout, and not a "game". While there are game-like aspects (e.g. high score list, etc.), it's emphasis is on giving you a great cardio workout. And it does that.

But, that's not to say that it isn't fun. It is fun. There is something incredibly satisfying about hitting the targets and seeing them burst into a spray of neon color. Getting into a good rhythm and powering my way through the routines gives me an incredible rush of positive energy.

As for the quality of the workout, you'll find that you get out of it what you put in. Some knowledge of actual boxing (or martial arts) is probably required to really enjoy this and get the most out of it. You don't need to be Sugar Ray Leonard, but If you don't already know how to throw a proper punch, BoxVR may not appeal to you. As of this writing, BoxVR doesn't teach you how to box or throw  punches. The short tutorial is helpful, but it won't serve to teach a complete beginner.

One criticism of the current state of BoxVR is that the "calorie" counter is ... aspirational, at best. By which I mean that if you put 100% effort and proper form and power into each punch, then the calories displayed in the game may be somewhat accurate. It's possible, however, to do the routines "lightly" and simply touch the targets and still get points. In that case, you will not be burning anywhere near the number of calories displayed. The displayed calories are therefore misleading, and I wish the developers would be even more clear that the calorie count is a rough estimate of an optimal workout and not an accurate measure of what you personally are achieving in a given workout (they do have a blanket statement to that effect in the fine print at the start of the game).

As I write this, BoxVR is still in early access, and there are regular updates coming from the developers as they add new features and make changes. I've found a few hiccups in the game: some odd behavior and a glitch here and there. That said, the developers appear (at the time of this writing) to be very responsive and seem to care about making their product better.

If you have some experience with boxing (or cardio boxing, or martial arts, or what have you) and are looking for a fun workout, then you could do far worse that give BoxVR at try.

38468017.review:
I was looking for a more active workout compared to Audioshield which has been my go to for a while, but I never felt like it was really doing anything.

I've done a few 15 minute sessions of this so far, and I really can only make it 15 minutes in my current shape.

It feels like a great cardio workout, and while the calorie burn counts are probably exaggerated, my muscles the next day definitely felt the burn.

Definitely a good choice for a VR workout, though I don't think it lends itself as well to just playing music as games devoted to that like Audioshield and Holodance.

38435149.review:
So, I love rhytm games and I love the workout you get from them. I've only put in a short session so far, and let me tell you, this thing is designed to kick your ass as gradually as possible. I highly recommend this game. There's a neat calorie burn count, and the game is highly intuitive. There's basically an instruction on screen for everything you need to do. It's obvious that working out was the main goal here. The built in tracks are pretty good, too! Really fun to punch and duck to these tracks. I can't wait to try some of my own music and see how that all syncs up. 

Boxing glove tracking can be a bit of a pain, but you can adjust this in the menu. There are times I swear I hit the orbs, but it clocked as a miss. I'm still new to the game, so it's very likely me being a noob. Height and weight measurements are taken at the start of the game, which is great because it feels like the workouts are really personalized that way. 

This will work your arms, chest, legs, core, and plenty of cardio. Maybe more, but I haven't gotten that far yet. I would be playing more right now if I wasn't so damn tired lol.

Secondly, make sure to check the "static" checkbox on each non-movable object. It's weird that the game has tiny lag issues and this is just one of the things that could be the case. I'm on a GTX 1080 TI, Fallout 4 VR didn't lag so neither should this.

I give it... A solid 3 out of 5. Good, but as it is early access, room for improvement.

1. Straight punches and uppercuts work fine, as does blocking. But hooks... Are BAD. I can consistenly hit everything but hooks, right or left. In fact, when I DO hit them, it's more like I'm doing an awkward sideways uppercut.

37825923.review:
I will say, in this game's favour, it has a LOT of potential. In barely 20 minutes of play I could really feel the strain it put on my chest. I get a sense that the people behind it know what they are doing. Although the calorie counter seems a little... optimistic? Put another way, if I were really burning that many calories I'd have the BMI of a stick insect. (...wistful sigh)

Also, I am an idiot, so take my feedback with a pinch of salt... this is an Early Access title so there's scope for change, and there's lots of positive reviews as well... etc etc.

That said, out of the box this game breaks one of the most simple rules of game development: don't needlessly frustrate the user!!

The premise is to exercise by hitting orbs in particular fashion, but the gameplay is very unrewarding because unless you do precisely what the game wants you to, the orbs phase right through your fists... And what it wants isn't clear! The biggest offenders were hitting the orbs from the sides. Uppercuts seem to work fairly well. 

This is game development 101!!! If I hit the orb... I HIT THE ORB!! Argh. By all means deduct points, or tell me my technique is wrong/isn't hard enough/etc etc... but REGISTER that I hit the orb and give me the feedback through the controller!! Don't phase it through my angry, flailing limbs like I became a ghost for 200 milliseconds. Straight punches work perfectly for instance, even if you lazily extend your fist and wait for the orb to blithely plow into it.

I survived about 20 minutes, with a break in between to test Audioshield and confirm that yes, that is way, WAY better for a workout and a million times less frustrating, and then take my arm weights off to see if them slowing down my punches was causing the hits not to count. But it wasn't! Yep... if you're trying to be like Piccolo from Dragonball Z training with hundreds of pounds of weights on your body, you can keep on doing what you're doing, it isn't affecting your gameplay here, it seems.

I varied the speed, to no avail. I varied the timing, to no avail. I tried adjusting the glove position relative to my controllers to ensure I really hit the orbs squarely on the side (THAT is a cool feature, I like that) but to no avail. Bewildered, I began to question my sanity. I even tried looking at videos of blokes punching things to make sure I even understood what a proper hook was. Do I just not know how to punch stuff in the side? Should I have punched more stuff in the past? Fought more people throughout life? Maybe I could've tried to be angrier as a teenager, I don't know.

And then, as I reuminated over my newfound relatively nonviolent regrets of the past, I found the answer. The terrible, awful answer. It seems I have more success "slapping" the orbs. 

That's right... punch, duck, punch, uppercut, UNMANLY EFFEMINATE SLAPPING, punch, duck, punch... 

If I didn't feel silly before, I certainly did when I realised that was the only way to *partially* increase the chances of scoring a hit. I mean I don't mind if they do want me to slap dat but they should've said so, don't make it sound all fighty and awesome.

In short: If you're used to Audioshield, this is not for you. It's VERY frustrating to play. Stick with Audioshield, pick an aggressive song on Elite difficulty, and try not to die by the end of it. If you've never played Audioshield and want to get reaaaally good at slapping things, this game is right up your street.

37682733.review:

37544351.review: muy bueno para practicar deporte, en este caso boxeo, es muy ameno y divertido, recomentado

37237401.review:
For some VR is a means of improving social contact. Others want to feel immersed. Pretend to be a war hero. A cyber ninja. For some it's about weight loss.

Weight loss? Yes, weight loss. See: During VR gameplay you move your body a lot. Wether it's steps or other physical movements, you tend to burn a lot of calories. There is even a case of someone losing more than 50 pounds playing a VR game. So losing weight and VR comes hand-in-hand. But of course these games aren't really focused on cardio.

That's where BOXVR comes in. 

Unlike other games, this game (well, fitness program might be a better fit) has been made with real fitness instructors aboard the advisory train. It's aim? Get your cardio going and shed some weight while you're at it.

The gameplay is simple. You punch, dodge and block incoming balls to the beat of your own music. 

You hit them straight forward, you do uppercuts and sidejabs. Sometimes you'll have to put your arms up to dodge, sometimes you'll be squatting. It's very simple to pick-up-and-play. But the thing is: You're continously moving. The great thing about BOXVR is that you actually have to throw in some weight with your punches. You don't just touch the balls, no. You need to actually exercise and punch. The squats add to the workout so by the end of a session your whole body will have had some work. 

Incoming projectiles are generated based on your own music. That's right, you can load-up your own music straight into the game and it'll use it to custom-tailor a workout to the beats of your own music. You can choose from 3 difficulties: Easy, Medium and Hard. I, personally, recommend hard. It'll keep you moving continously and after 30 minutes I definitely felt a little bit sore in my arms and I was sweating like crazy. A sweatband comes highly recommended. You don't want your foam to soak up your sweet due to hygienic reasons. 

During a workout the game gives you a score (it's really fun trying to beat your own scores!), the amount of calories burned, time left and your current hit streak. It's simplistic yet: this game requires nothing more than the basic information. Calories burned are taken from calculations based on your height and weight which you input into the game. I kinda feel like the game overshoots a little with how many calories you burn, but that's understandable considering you don't need measurement hardware for the game to function. 

Of course, with the game still being in Early Access, there are some bugs here 'n there. For example: I think the calories-burned tracker kinda overshoots a little bit. Sometimes the game won't track burned calories in songs you've loaded in. Everything else functions perfectly. All the punch hits are detected instantly and flawlessly. The graphics are alright, the motions are great and fluid. The UI easy to use. 

All in all: I don't see BOXVR as a game. I see it more as a cardio workout. Want to lose some weight? Go for it. Want to stay in shape/keep your cardio up? Go for it!

I know I'll be throwing that gym membership out the window for sure. ;)

36603735.review:
So, I have to wholeheartedly recommend this, because this is actually going to keep me working out because it's a hell of a lot funner than regular exercise. There's a few things I would like to see improved though:

- The UI has some annoying issues:
        - if you select, say, the Power 4 training, which you have to move the carousel over for, you can't move it back after you finish the song, it's stuck there until you restart,
        - if you need to scroll down in the file browser, and you come back after you finish a song, it'll scroll farther every time until you can't select folders in the middle anymore, you have to restart to fix it.
        - when it's analysing your music, the UI elements don't update to the new track unless you go to another screen and come back


- You should be able to select your music folder so you don't have to completely navigate to it everytime, and you should be able to favourite songs so you don't have to navigate to them everytime as well.
- The beat detection on some songs is pretty terrible. You need songs that have a strong bassline, and don't change tempo.
- Being able to make custom workout tracks, and upload them to the workshop (like Intralism) would make this game perfect, in my opinion. The beats that are autogenerated don't always match up with the music how you want them to, and they get boring and repetitive after a while.

36088168.review:
This is bar none, the best workout VR game.  Not sure I would call it a rhythm game as it's very light on the rhythm part.  The in-game music is okay and the workouts made for that are on beat.  However, when you use your own music, it's really more of a workout, while you're listening to your music.  And that's okay, in fact, it's more than okay.

That's because the workouts are amazing.  And they can be tuned to your level of fitness.  If you are completely out of shape, then the beginner courses will get your heart pumping.  If you're already in decent shape, then you can select the harder difficulties.  You can do specific timed workouts or you can go for endurance (workout til you drop).  You can select your own tunes and the game will make a workout that matches the musical intensity, if not the beats exactly.  

The game will either do left stance or right stance (boxing stances) and you'll jab, hook, upppercut, block, duck down, or weave.  Timing is everything and combos of ducking while blocking to immediately uppercut to another duck ups the intensity.  The three environments are nothing special and the graphics are simple.  But it gets the job done.  This is a VR workout game done to be as fun/immersive as possible with tunes, not a music rhtyhm game in the traditional sense.  

Rate 8/10 worth every penny, beats going to the gym, excellent cardio workout ... just wish more footwork drills were involved and more environments 

[spoiler] I got to punch stuff hard while listenting to Tool, 'nuff said [/spoiler]

36046423.review:

最重要的是開發者有在持續修正各種BUG及新增功能。幾乎每天都會開來運動一下。好評！

36000512.review: I Initially reviewed this game after one play session when I bought it a month or so ago. It wowed me at the time and I was mega excited about it but I've now had the game a month so thought an updated review would be appropriate. Well first off I have to say this game has plenty of staying power. I had bought this alongside several other fitness type games to get me into shape and this, far and away is the most addictive and compelling. I have now put in 25 hours and haven't missed a day's training since I bought it, averaging 45 minutes a night. My fitness has hugely improved, I have a flat stomach now and I've even started doing push ups and pull ups after workouts as it's got me fired up to train! The gameplay is simple but compelliing, and works the whole body. Power workouts give you lots of squats and leg work, Speed workouts are great fun allowing you throw dozens up fast combinations and really get into a fitness zone training like you're Floyd Mayweather. Endurance mixes the two styles and extends the workouts to between 20 and 35 minutes. Some of the workouts are short but it literally takes about 10 seconds to transition from the end of one workout to starting a new one so don't avoid them, and they are timed well giving you a chance to wipe the sweat from your headset before you dive into the next one. In all I one hundred percent recommend this game!

35977772.review: Time flies playing this, devs are super active and is the best "game" out there in its style on the market.

35953304.review: It's a fun game of having a shadow boxing type of workout while feeling like a game similar to audio surf.

35952237.review:
So far this is by far the best workout game I have played! 

The each set is designed perfectly with the music and is very satisfing to box through. Importantly this game the original music is really, really good, but if it's not to your taste you can use your own and the beat detection is the best I have seen in VR. 

There are many different workouts of differing length which means that it fit into my workout if I want to mix it with other games or concentrate on endurance.

Wholeheartedly recccomend it!

To the Devs two minor requests: 1 - Is it possible to make a playlist of songs for a longer workout? 2 - When there's a break between songs could we get a timedown so it's possible to grab a drink?

Ta!

35938336.review:
BOXVR is one of the best workout games I've ever seen. Unlike other fitness games, it's legitimately fun and actually feels like a game. I used the power workout, and it absolutely wrecked my thighs with all the ducking - I couldn't walk properly for a few days afterwards.

This game is even better to play when friends are watching. Watching the person in the headset fighting and ducking always spawns lots of cheers and excitement. It's even better when you have that go-hard friend, or the amateur boxer, taking it a bit too seriously. Recommended for anyone interested in a workout that doesn't feel like a chore!

35904513.review:
Great physical exercise game, devs recently improved it a lot so I can wholly recommend it.

Don't expect a dance game, even if the sequences kind of follow the music. The main goal is to do good exercises.
The variety of moves is very nice, which compensate that target positions are quite monotonous.
Timing and speed required to validate bubble hit from the sides (uppercuts and hooks) are quite difficult to pull off. It can be frustrating at times, but a satisfying challenge.

As often with this kind of games, the small number of body tracked points leave some leeway to cut corners. Sometimes I have a tendency to optimize my movements to get better scores, but I enjoy more doing proper moves (better exercise). So maybe watch out for that.

35892196.review: Great responsiveness from the devs, and the game (workout) keeps getting better and better. Two thumbs up!

35831075.review: My partner and I have each lost 10+ pounds using this game.  Highly recommended.

If you watch the trailer, and think that would be fun to do a quick session of each night.

The game is great. I love night mode. Only thing i can say is i have trouble with upper cuts. they dont seem to track well. I have to do werid upper cut movomeant to get them to hit. But over all love it and would buy it 10 times over.

edit: they lisen to comments and work on game. upper cuts are now flawless and work, every thing works smooth. also there new harder work out modes are even more fun then ever. this game just gets better and better. I have no idea how they could update this game any more to make it any better. But i am excited for every update they come up with.

35510602.review:
I have audioshield, fastest fist and thrill of the fight. They're all great in their own right. BoxVR is the game most tailored towards getting a workout with some solid form. It's great fun with a lot of potential.

That said, there is plenty of room for improvement. Right now, you can only change the angle of your gloves in one plane, so that your virtual gloves are bent upwards if your real arms are sticking straight forward in thumbs up position. We just need a rotation setting for thumbward and pinky-side adjustment.

I'd also appreciate some more challenging workouts. I know this is tailored toward having a consistent and easy to follow routine, but having true challenge would make this experience so much more 

Finally, I understand this is outside the scope of the game, but picking our own music would be much appreicated. Sound boxing and audioshield do it pretty well. BoxVR has some great mechanics so I hope these developers can do it too.

This game is fun, the workouts are good, calorie counts are nearly accurate (about 5% high from measurements taken with a HR monitor), BUT after running them a few times they're really repetitive so I cannot recommend this game until the other modes are added.

I felt a bit duped when I first got the game since from the video it looked like they were already functional, and it's been over a month now and they're still not added. Hopefully the devs get on this instead of making more repetitive trailers showing features that don't yet exist. 

Great concept but it needs finishing.

EDIT: After spending much more time on this game and seeing how active the decs are, I would recommend, just understand it's not perfect yet.

33080344.review:
Ich dachte mir, warum soll ich soviel Geld für ein Early Access Spiel ausgeben... und ich bin froh darum.

Obwohl es nur 5 verschieden Programme gibt, macht es einfach nur Spaß. Die verschiedenen Programme gepaart mit coole House bzw. Elektro Musik spornt mich jeden Tag eine Runde zu spielen. Und wenn ich seh, dass ich so in einer halben Stunde ca 900 kcal verbrannt habe, ist die Motivation umso größer, das Spiel wieder zu spielen.

Die boxhandschuhe und die aufliegenden Bälle zu Boxen, sei es gerade aus oder von der Seite bzw. von unten sind sehr präzise. 

Und die Programmierer sind dran die Bugs auszubessern, Ideen umzusetzen oder kleine schönheitsfehler zu bereinigen.

Ich werde weiterhin spielen und freue mich rießig auf zukünftige Updates.

PS: seit ich den htc vive deluxe Audio strap habe, fällt auch kein problem mehr mit den schnellen Bewegungen an. Auch die angelegten Kopfhörer sind praktischer als die mitgelieferten inear Kopfhörer, die immer wieder gerne bei mir rausfallen.

32421917.review:
This is the workout game I've been looking for! I have tried most of them, and BOXVR is the first game that really brings all the different gameplay types together for a full-body workout. 

It's early access so a few features aren't enabled yet, but there's a good number of programs to go through. The graphics are clean and ran smoothly. Each program has different instrumental electronic music with a good beat. 

I can't wait to see how this game progresses. As-is I think it's an excellent purchase.

it's more classic fitness than Soundboxing.

The music is average good. it works fine. I'm sure that will be improved soon.... i hope :D

Go buy it if you want VR Fitness with real coach work. Breathe, Punch, Rest, retry

32416004.review:
8 out of 10

I'm really keen on using VR for fitness and BOXVR is a total winner for me. I'm really enjoying the different excercises, It's sort of like Audioshield with punching. BOXVR has different routines to support speed, power, and endurance. During a session it includes breaks and swapping stances. And each segment of the session is a different sequence of punches and dodging. It feels really well balanced.

The game feels really good already and there's loads of untapped scope for adding more variety to the exercises, the greyed out sections shows this is already planned on the roadmap.

My Steam library is packed with a number of high intensity VR games, but they aren't specifically designed for fitness training but they get you tired pretty quickly. BOXVR is better than those, the pacing keeps you working hard but not to exhaustion.

39471648.review: Workouts felt natural even to this SHORTY 👩 It's punches, leans, squats, rest period all pro level here❗️ Spooky 👻 Enviroment was my FAVE 🦇

39585359.review: The first time I had any experience with motion control boxing was with Wii Sports, and that was a fantastic start to the OBVIOUS utilization of hand controls in a hand to hand combat game.  This game adds on that base idea with superior visuals, an excellent (albeit short) soundtrack, and brings back that idea of getting your ass off the couch and immersing yourself in a full body gaming experience.  I'd like to see this being used more in the future as an in-home workout routine because as it stands, it is a missed opportunity that this game grabs on to and does not dissapoint.

39570286.review:
Easily the most fun I've had in any workout game. If you like the rhythm gameplay of Guitar Hero/Rock Band and don't mind punching stuff, you'll enjoy this one. You might want to try wearing a sweatband or getting a cover for the headset padding though, because you will break a sweat in this game.

One gripe is there's no easy daily calorie count in the data view - it's there, but it's part of a graph of your all-time calorie burn and it's hard to read (unless I'm missing something). I generally don't give a damn about how many calories I've burned over the entire time I've used an app or workout machine - I only care about that day's count. So hopefully that's a feature they'll add. Steam Workshop support would also be great - I'd love to model environments and targets for this thing.

I usually avoid early access games, but I'm glad I took a chance on this one.
